title: A Plea for Deliverance
shortSummary: Psalm 70 is a brief but urgent prayer of David calling on God for swift deliverance from his enemies. It expresses deep dependence on God’s help and a desire for His name to be magnified among those who love salvation. This psalm highlights the believer’s trust in God amid distress and opposition.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm, King of Israel, who appeals to God for urgent help and deliverance from his enemies.

keyCharacters.name: Enemies of David
keyCharacters.description: Those who seek to harm David, described as pursuing his soul and desiring his hurt.

definitions.definition: An urgent plea for God to act quickly and without delay.
To be put to shame, confused, or humiliated.
To be caused to experience disorder, shame, or defeat.
To be glorified, praised, or exalted.

outline.heading: Urgent Plea for Deliverance
outline.description: David urgently calls on God to hasten His deliverance and help, emphasizing the immediacy of his need and his dependence on the LORD.

outline.heading: Judgment on the Enemies
outline.description: David prays that those who seek to harm him be put to shame and confusion, highlighting the justice of God’s intervention against the wicked.

outline.heading: Joy for God’s Seekers
outline.description: A call for all who seek God and love His salvation to rejoice and continually magnify His name, showing the communal aspect of worship and trust.

outline.heading: David’s Humble Dependence
outline.description: David acknowledges his poverty and neediness, reaffirming God as his help and deliverer and pleading for no delay in God’s saving action.

application: In times of distress, believers should earnestly and urgently call on God for help, trusting in His timely deliverance.
Christians can take comfort that God hears prayers for justice and will bring shame upon those who oppose His people.
Believers are encouraged to rejoice and magnify God continually, especially when experiencing His salvation.
Recognizing our spiritual poverty and need fosters humility and dependence on God as our ultimate helper and deliverer.

keyVerses.text: Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O LORD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures the urgent cry for God’s swift intervention, emphasizing reliance on His power in times of trouble.

keyVerses.text: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the joy and praise that should characterize the lives of those who trust in God’s salvation.

keyVerses.text: But I am poor and needy: make haste unto me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O LORD, make no tarrying.
keyVerses.significance: This verse expresses humble dependence on God and the urgency of His help, reminding believers to trust Him in their weakness.
